meanings.definition: Smooth or polish (a metal object) by hammering.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith was planishing the metal to make it shiny.
meanings.sent2: The artisan planished the silver bowl to give it a glossy look.
meanings.sent3: The planishing process made the metal so smooth that it reflected like a mirror.
meanings.sent4: Her gentle planishing of the metal turned it into a gleaming masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of planishing echoed through the workshop, creating a mesmerizing melody.

meanings.definition: To give a smooth finish to (metal) by hammering.
meanings.sent1: The craftsman was planishing the metal to make it sleek.
meanings.sent2: They planished the copper sheet until it had a flawless surface.
meanings.sent3: The planishing technique transformed the metal into a work of art.
meanings.sent4: With each strike, the hammer planished the metal into perfection.
meanings.sent5: The planishing motion was like a dance, gracefully refining the metal.
